events.name: iOS Dev Scout August Meetup
events.description:
Venue: #09-01, PayPal Office at Suntec Tower 5 Speakers: • Suraj Pathak - iOS Engineer at PropertyGuru  • Jay Jun Tan Agenda: • 6:30pm: Come have some pizza, say hello to other iOS devs  • 7:10pm: Scripting in Swift by Suraj • 7:40pm: Swift Literal Convertibles by Jay Jun • 8:15pm: Swift Quiz (there will be some prizes) • 8:30pm: Show & Tell (if any)  About iOS Conf SG: iOS Conf SG is an annual iOS conference organized by us. This year's conference is happening on 20th and 21st of October. Find more about the conference here. 


Sponsors:  Dinner is kindly sponsored by https://hired.com  Refer a participating candidate or employer on Hired and score yourself a S$300 travel voucher!
events.location: PayPal office in Suntec, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985 Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: Leveraging Jenkins on Azure
events.description:
Dear Jenkiners! I am pleased to announce that our next meetup will be jointly organized with Microsoft Singapore. Apart from clicking the Yes button here, please also register your attendance at Microsoft's registration page as there may be others who are not on meetup.com registering for the event from Microsoft's event site so we need to track the numbers. Synopsis Is Jenkins, the de facto open source continuous integration tool, part of your DevOps story? Microsoft Azure offers extensive DevOps capabilities too and plays well with the Jenkins platform. Join us for a live session on 22nd Aug to learn more about synergies between Jenkins and Microsoft Azure, which will also include a Java web app continuous integration scenario leveraging Jenkins and Azure app service. Agenda 18:30 - 19:00    Registration and snacks19:00 - 20:00   Jenkins CI with Azure Talk & demo20:00 - 20:30  Q&A Speakers' Profile 1) Andrey Terekhov – Open Source Lead, Microsoft Asia Pacific2) Louis Leong – Technical Evangelist, Microsoft Singapore Andrey Terekhov is an Open Source Sales & Marketing Lead at Microsoft Asia Pacific. A 12-year veteran of Microsoft, he is responsible for defining Microsoft’s open source strategy and developing businesses in the APAC region - with a focus on scaling up open source workloads on the Microsoft Azure cloud platform. Louis Leong is a Technical Evangelist at Microsoft Singapore working with teams to drive DevOps adoption, agile practices and development of best practices with Visual Studio and Team Services. He has a deep passion for software engineering and has been involved in building enterprise scale applications for years. 


***** Note: This meetup is free for all to attend *****
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, Level 22 Room BR-01, One Marina Boulevard

events.name: Its time for  SG  Linux Kernel meetup !!.
events.description:
On the agenda items we have tech talk - 'Breaking the limits of x86' by Dan, (pls ref to the synopsis below for more details), general kernel discussions, and light snacks. 


Time: 22 Aug, Monday. 7:00PM to 8:00PM Venue: Oracle,  Viva Business Park,  750, #04-04, Chai Chee Road,  Singapore[masked]  (its near Decathlon) How to access:   - By train, alight at Kembangan, take any-bus-except-#26   - 2 stops away, alight at Decathlon and walk through the Decathlon for block 750, take the lift behind Gelare   - Oracle is on 4th floor, pls knock the door or call me [masked])  to open the door 


Talk: 'Breaking the limits of x86 Synopsis: Daniel presents how to transform commodity servers into a single massively parallel system, the challenges faced and how they were solved in Linux and with bespoke silicon. 


-Anand [masked] | [masked]
events.location: Oracle, Viva Business Park (aka: Technopark@chai chee), #04-04, 750 Chai Chee Road, Singapore

events.name: WordPress & PHP Combined Meetup (August 2016)
events.description: Hello! So in lieu of PHP Conference Asia happening in August, we're combining our meetups together with the PHP Community. Incidentally, we have some overlaps with the organisers and speakers for the PHP Conference and WordCamp Singapore so we thought it'd be a great idea to synergise. Please note that this is going to be very developer oriented. You'll likely see many PHP developers from different countries in this meetup. Talks HTTP/2 and Asynchronous APIs by Davey Shafik, Akamai Technologies Get ready for the peak season: scaling your PHP web app by Harald Zeitlhofer, Dynatrace Building tools to support an Open Source Community - WordPress as Case Study by Dion Hulse, Automattic Venue: Microsoft Singapore's building management requires you bring a photo ID for entry into the building. Please call Jon at[masked] if you have an issue getting to the meetup. Do not abuse the number please :) We're always looking for speakers and volunteers to help with our meetups! Please contact Valentine, Jon or Robert if you're interested in helping out. Light refreshments will be provided (likely pizza and soft drinks)
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, Level 22, Room CF12, One Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018989
